byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Sandra E. Garcia, Nate Schweber and Ashley Southall contributed reporting. Doris Burke and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Jessica White died shielding her children from gunfire on a Bronx playground in June. Few witnesses have emerged, frustrating overworked detectives, and her killer eluded the police.

headline.print_headline: A Mother Slain on a Playground, a Sea of Witnesses Gone Silent
headline.main: A Mother Is Shot Dead on a Playground, and a Sea of Witnesses Goes Silent

snippet: Jessica White died shielding her children from gunfire on a Bronx playground in June. Few witnesses have emerged, frustrating overworked detectives, and her killer eluded the police....
abstract: Fatal shooting of Jessica White, young mother of three who died shielding her children from gunshots on South Bronx playground, receives minimal priority from local police precinct strapped for resources in area where rising gun violence and drugs wield more authority than law enforcement; White's family believes her race and poverty level of neighborhood have prevented case from receiving adequate attention from city or public (Series: Murder in the 4-0).
